titleStmt.title: Richard Durbin to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4158

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Sept 23d 1863
To his Excellency The Governor of Ky

your petition Richard Durbin states at the September ^term^ Inst of the Edmondson Equity & Criminal Court he was found guily of Selling Spiritious Liquor to a minor He states that a neighbor his sent a boy for a quart of whisky & your petitione sent it to him by said boy, & for that he was fined $50 & costs
your peitioner states he is poor has a large family to support & prays your honors clemency in the remission of said fine & will ever paray
The undersigned state that they are neighbors of Richard Durbin & that they believe the statements made by him are true & they Join him in his prayer for the remission of said fine

J E Bacon P J C C C
Jas Walker Jun
J. P. Vincent J P E C
W Haslip
S Brooks
T R Zetter
James Lock
Aron Lawson
P H Sohan P. M
Bradley Meredith
James Vincent
I Certify that I am personly aCquainted with those men and now them to be Honerable union men and I Join Mr Durbin in his Prayer for Remission of Sd fine F, Meridith P M

The undersigned States he was counsel for the petitioner that upon trial of the case it was proven by Wm Jones that his father and a neighbour sent him to the house of the petitioner for a quart of whickey which he got and paid for and took home without drinking any of it to this father,s that he was a miner this is substantially the case Mr Durbin is poor & ill able to pay the fine I hope Executive clemency will be extended he deserves it

T E Bramlette
Oct 5h/63
vs
Richd Durbin
